The leader died last week. Richard Farnsworth committed suicide in Aden. A terrorist group killed the hostages with explosives in 1985.

[AGT He] carried out the [PRD assassination]. [VCT John] would have been [PRD killed] if he hadn’t moved. More than 200 [VCT people] have [PRD died]. [AGT John] tried to [PRD kill] [VCT Mary]. Terrorist [AGT groups] have threatened to [PRD kill] foreign [VCT hostages]. [AGT John Hinkley] attempted to [PRD assassinate] [VCT Ronald Reagan]. A [INT car bomb] exploded [TIM Thursday] in the heart of [PLC Jerusalem], [PRD killing] at least two [VCT people], police said. Should he not pay the money, [AGT they] would [PRD kill] [VCT him]. Six [VCT men] were [PRD murdered], including [VCT Bob] (in [PLC Paris]) and [VCT Joe] (in [PLC Reims]). The [PRD dying] [VCT man] had a last wish. My [PRD deceased] [VCT mother] was a hero. The crash left [VCT 30] [PRD dead]. Six [PRD murders] occurred in [PLC France]. Six attacks occurred in France, including the [PRD assassination] of [VCT Bob]. Six attacks occurred in France, including the [PRD killing] of [VCT Joe]. Two [VCT Palestinians] were [PRD killed] as they staged a drive-by ambush on an Israeli jeep in the [PLC Gaza Strip] near the Israeli settlement of [PLC Gush Katif] [TIM Saturday afternoon].
The [PRD slain] [VCT leader] was buried. [VCT She] was [PRD killed] in an [INT automobile] accident. The [PRD assassination] of the once-relatively obscure Fatah leader [VCT Obaiyat], whom the army blamed particularly for leading nocturnal shooting on Gilo, a neighborhood in southeastern Jerusalem, was regarded as a grave step by Israeli commentators. In other violence, a Palestinian [VCT worker] was shot [PRD dead] in the [PLC Gaza Strip] and in the West Bank, another Palestinian, a teenager, was shot by Israeli soldiers during clashes. Canadian authorities arrested two Vancouver-area [AGT men] on Friday and charged them in the [PRD deaths] of 329 [VCT passengers] and crew [VCT members] of an Air-India Boeing 747 that blew up over the [PLC Irish Sea] in [TIM 1985], en route from Canada to London.
